p:
The increasing risk of multi-drug resistance (MDR), the high cost and the adverse side effects of chemotherapy justify the growing need to develop new chemotherapeutic drugs. Several studies have been reported on endophytes to search for novel and effective drugs for cancer therapy
23, 24 . In this study, the chloroformic fungal extract showed significant antiproliferative activity against the HeLa, HCT-15 and U87-MG cell lines with IC 50 values of 110 µg/ml, 51 µg/ml and 14 µg/ml respectively. In a similar study, on the crude extracts of Acinetobacter guillouiae an endophyte of Crinum macowanii Baker bulbs showed a good bioactive potential against U87MG glioblastoma cell line with IC 50 value of 6.25 µg/ml
25 . Another endophytic fungus Penicillium sp . isolated from Hopea hainanensis also displayed good cytotoxicity against HepG2 cell line
27 .
